pros: This hospital is on an island and most work there because of that.  Employees belong to a union, which is why they are paid decent wages.
cons:
Whidbey is run by a CEO who is overpaid.   They day we were outsourced, he stopped smiling and saying hello. HR laid off transcription dept in the most unprofessional way and even tho they said we could find jobs at the hospital, there weren't any we qualified for.  CEO said he didn't attend this meeting because of a sick relative. Right. 
Now I find out they don't accept my health insurance, obtained thru the affordable care act. Does that make any sense?  A public hospital that doesn't accept United Healthcare Community Plan. I can go to the ED thankfully, as EMTALA forces the hospital to examine and stabilize a patient coming to the ED. 
The board of commissioners have changed their monthly meetings to start at  7:00 am instead of 6:00 pm, so most of the public probably won't attend. 
They are four million in debt and blame it on Meditech. 
Latest trouble was a nurse assaulting a patient in the ER. 
Now they think they can change the public's opinion with a rebranding?

pros: Loved my coworkers! They were the best part of the job! Beautiful location!
cons: Lack of knowledge on how healthcare systems run off of an island. "We've always done it this way" mindset and definitely not open to new ideas. Sexual harassment is viewed as a misunderstanding, most  management is woefully unknowledgable and will make life hell if you buck up against them, my manager told me that she wasn't in charge of my morale. No one to look to for the example and leadership then.  Management , from the CEO right on down to the departments needs a serious overhaul and restructure.

review_title: I feel I wasted my career due to lack of opportunities.
pros: Friendly co-workers, great and knowledgable staff, M.D. and hospitalist  on site, f.airly good nurse to patient ratios, small rural community
cons: Difficult to move up the career ladder , administration does not seem to care about employees, shortage of supplies to do your job,  patient rooms are too small for 2 patients and therefore lack of privacy for patients, computer system is not user friendly

review_title: Working here put me in fear of my license.
pros: Many of the people who work at this hospital are kind, good people who are compassionate and mean well.
cons: Highly unprofessional work environment. Managers seemed to be hired based on cronyism over any actual work experience. HIPAA violated constantly. I felt unsafe. The system penalizes self-reporting and the culture does not seem to be one where progress or improvement are desired; rather a desire to sweep things under the rug. This results in a very unsafe environment for patients and a scary experience for employees.

review_title: Wish there were more advancement opportunities
pros: Co-workers are very friendly.  Always have training to improve customer service.  Managers seem to really care what their employees feel.  The CEO will speak to all employees no matter what level he or she is at. They are always looking for ways to improve the hospital.
cons: Advancement opportunity is not really present.

review_title: Hostile work environment, inefficient management, terrible place for employees to thrive.
pros: Good Benefits and pay. Sorry cannot think of any other good reasons to work here. Almost all senior people at WGH are currently seeking employment elsewhere.
cons: Gossip, hostile work environment, treated with disrespect and talked down to, management is inexperienced with managing people and that shows. Everyone is out for themselves, no camaraderie or real team work. No room for advancement, no quality of work.

review_title: Lovely coworkers, difficult communication with management.
pros: Pay, plenty of hours, good teamwork with other techs on your team. Starting to get top of the line equipment.
cons: Management is extremely difficult to work with, scheduling, and communication is lacking. Even with a set schedule- if there isn’t enough staff they will move your schedule around to fit the hospitals needs without warning.

pros: As the title states, the teamwork is phenomenal. The patient load is usually pretty light and the patients are mostly very pleasant.
cons: Being a smaller hospital, there is a lack of resources as compared to larger hospitals. It's mostly not an issue, but occasionally can throw a big kink into the work day.

pros: It is a job and supports the surrounding community. There is a huge amount of potential if managed correctly.  Hopefully new management will come into the hospital to reorganize.
cons: Very Very poor management.  The entire hospital is in shambles and the community confidence is very low. They have devastated alot of people's careers and life on this small beautiful island.

pros: Close to home, that's it...
cons: Administration is AWFUL and acts is if they are above everyone. No room for advancement. Whole environment is micromanaging. Most people (with the exception of administration and EMS) are grossly underpaid. Can't even afford health insurance for myself and my family working at a hospital for God's sake. Terrible place to work.

pros: great flexibility, manager promoted cross training and advanced learning
cons: Can't complain, I learned a lot there!

cons: In-house cook position under union, no room for more cook hours due to seniority have to supplement with dietary duties
